title: Ensure ntp is Configured
overview: <paragraph>ntp is a daemon which implements the Network Time Protocol (NTP). It is designed to synchronize system clocks across a variety of systems and use a source that is highly accurate. More information on NTP can be found at http://www.ntp.org . ntp can be configured to be a client and/or a server.</paragraph><paragraph></paragraph><paragraph>If ntp is in use on the system proper configuration is vital to ensuring time synchronization is working properly.</paragraph>
remediation: <paragraph>Add or edit restrict lines in /etc/ntp.conf to match the following:</paragraph><paragraph></paragraph><paragraph>restrict -4 default kod nomodify notrap nopeer noquery</paragraph><paragraph>restrict -6 default kod nomodify notrap nopeer noquery</paragraph><paragraph></paragraph><paragraph>Add or edit server lines to /etc/ntp.conf as appropriate:</paragraph><paragraph></paragraph><paragraph>server <remote-server></paragraph><paragraph>Add or edit the OPTIONS in /etc/sysconfig/ntpd to include '-u ntp:ntp':</paragraph><paragraph></paragraph><paragraph>OPTIONS="-u ntp:ntp"</paragraph>
